prompt: Discuss the analytical approach a structural engineer takes when designing a mid-rise building in an earthquake-prone zone. Highlight how seismic loads are considered, equations used in structural analysis, safety margins, and design documentation.

criteria.name: Seismic Load Consideration
criteria.description: Demonstrates understanding of seismic forces and how they impact structural design.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly identifies seismic loads, site conditions, and applies relevant codes.
performance_descriptors.good: Identifies basic seismic loads and references building codes.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions earthquake forces with limited detail.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Brief or unclear understanding of seismic impact.

criteria.name: Use of Structural Analysis Methods
criteria.description: Applies appropriate structural models, equations, and analytical techniques.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Correctly applies dynamic/static models and explains assumptions.
performance_descriptors.good: Uses suitable equations with minor detail gaps.
performance_descriptors.average: Some equation use; lacks clarity or completeness.
performance_descriptors.poor: No use of structural equations or methods.

criteria.name: Safety Factors and Design Margin
criteria.description: Explains use of safety factors and code-based margins in design.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Integrates code-based safety margins with strong rationale.
performance_descriptors.good: Applies safety factors based on standards.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions safety but lacks full integration.
performance_descriptors.poor: No reference to safety or design codes.

criteria.name: Documentation and Communication
criteria.description: Presents the design using clear drawings, models, and technical reporting.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Professional diagrams and well-structured technical report included.
performance_descriptors.average: Basic explanation with limited visuals or structure.
performance_descriptors.poor: Lacks any meaningful documentation or visuals.

llm_questions: How are seismic forces calculated for buildings?
What analysis methods are used for earthquake design?
What safety factors are applied in seismic zones?
What building codes govern earthquake-resistant structures?
How are structural designs documented for approval?
llm_answers: Seismic forces are estimated using base shear equations: V = Cs Ã— W.
Static equivalent and modal response spectrum analyses are commonly used.
Safety factors include load combinations per AS1170.4 or IBC codes.
Design follows codes like Eurocode 8, ASCE 7, or AS1170.4.
Designs include structural drawings, force diagrams, and calculation reports.
